docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: FOR almost every disease, compulsion and life predicament, there is a self-help group in Connecticut. The demand for these groups, which bring people with common problems together, has grown. Last year, 75 groups surfaced, said the coordinator of a statewide clearinghouse, Vicki Spiro Smith of the Connecticut Self-Help/Mutual Support
